definition: the more the better
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
benefit/profit/advantage/beneficial/to increase/to add/all the more
surname Yi
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: Friends like capital, the more friends are the better the entrepreneur is.
sentences.chinese: 朋友尤如資本金，對創業者來說是多多益善。

sentences.english: The crabmeat and sashimi are so fresh and juicy that you'd no doubt want to order more.
sentences.chinese: 螃蟹肉和生魚片新鮮且多汁，你當然希望多多益善了。

sentences.english: Supermarkets use many subtle ploys to get you to buy more than you plan.
sentences.chinese: 超市刷着小聰明讓你買的多多益善。

sentences.english: Now I want other titles, as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 現在我想要更多的冠軍頭銜，多多益善。

sentences.english: Fresh air is good for health. Plenty is no plague.
sentences.chinese: 新鮮的空氣對身體健康很有好處，多多益善。

sentences.english: However, most of them still said that they needed more.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他們大多數人還是說多多益善。

definition: to accept without question/to take sth at face value
to weigh one's abilities and act accordingly/to act according to one's means/to cut one's coat according to one's cloth
Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
lit. measured in cartloads and gallons/fig. by the barrowload (i.e. lots and lots)/innumerable
nobody will find fault with extra courtesy (idiom)/courtesy costs nothing
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
better than nothing (idiom)
not to stint/to be generous (with praise etc)/to be prepared to (pay a fee, give of one's time etc)
to use sth to the full/to make the best use of everything
small token/mere trifle (used of one's gifts)
acceptable/desirable/worth having
many/much/a lot/lots and lots/more/even more
Many little things add up to sth great./Many little drops make an ocean. (idiom)
What can you have against it? (idiom)/We should do this./Go for it!
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)
to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
